file_content.text: When you get to the shrine, be patient. Look for an opportunity.
I'll send the ashes for analysis, but I'm more interested in the scroll.
It's sort of an epitaph--calls the Shining Man a "man of prophecy" who was "made whole in the Wellspring of the Shrine of Healing."
"Man of prophecy." Something to do with the Voss Force sensitives?
What does that mean?
Something not sit right with you?
You sound skeptical.
Not exactly directions to his employers, but it's a start. What do you think?
Maybe my trip wasn't a waste.
The Mystics have a whole library of prophecies. The rest of the Voss revere the Mystics because their prophecies are always right.
If the Mystics prophesied the Shining Man's arrival, it would explain why the Voss accepted him so easily. It's awfully convenient, though.
"Convenient" is one word for it. Any chance a prophecy was manipulated?
Agreed.
Always that chance. About the second part of the scroll, though--"made whole in the Wellspring of the Shrine...."
How do the Mystics operate, exactly? They're fortune-tellers, government advisors....
Tell me about the Mystics.
Influential as Dark Council, reclusive as the Jedi Masters. About the second part, though--"made whole in the Wellspring of the Shrine...."
"Made whole in the Wellspring of the Shrine of Healing." What does that part mean?
What about the rest?
The Shrine of Healing is a Mystic sanctuary where people go to be cured; the sick and dying, or the "spiritually wounded."
Only a handful of pilgrims manage to complete the trek each year. I'd guess if the Shining Man was there, it wasn't for spiritual reasons.
I need to find out what the Shining Man was up to.
The Mystics know something.
You make it sound like a death march.
Why is it so dangerous?
You've seen how bad it gets outside. But the Mystics don't seem to mind the rocks and the animals and the Gormak.
I've faced Jedi and Sith. I'm not afraid of their primitive cousins.
They won't know what hit them.
Primitive, not stupid. Don't underestimate the Mystics.
There's a pilgrimage camp not too far from Voss-Ka. One of the guides there can help you reach the shrine and the Wellspring.
My advice, if you'll take it... play by the Mystics' rules. It's not wise to defy the order of things.
I wondered if you would return. Perhaps the tea?
You return. Father, your friend...
Come share our meal. My brother Therod-Ton is with us. We celebrate.
Tell us of the stars.
There's not a lot for me to tell. I'd much rather hear about you.
[Flirt] You're my interest.
You are the... consummate diplomat.
I will try to entertain.
You could tell of your time on Voss.
Thank you. Dinner sounds lovely.
That's a fine suggestion.
Come meet Therod-Ton and my daughter...
So far, nothing has been more enchanting than the woman I met at the teahouse.
[Flirt] Where do I start...?
I don't think she gets it.
Not that I'm bothered, but you could dial down the charm.
There is more of Voss.
Come meet Therod-Ton and my son...
...I do not wish commando life. I welcome outsiders, not guard against them.
You would leave our world.
I would see Voss in other worlds. Your people bring change.
I wouldn't have pegged you for a military man.
You were a commando?
Every Voss must be a commando.
I saw shrines. The shape of time in rubble. Ruins are beauty.
Father says you came to see Voss. How did you meet?
...Vamo-Yeigh allows me to work in the Alien Enclave. Outsider faces, outsider materials.
You will never be an artist. But it is right.
Your people bring Voss opportunities. Be proud of your role.
We have a lot to offer this planet, and a lot to learn from you.
Both our societies benefit.
Many outsiders say this. The Three are patient. They will see.
Bas-Ton never said anything about your art.
You mentioned artwork?
I sculpt outsiders as meditation. You might sit for me.
Father's friends introduced outsider goods. Is this how you met?
He's being modest, but I got his name from a business partner. I'd been wanting to see this place for years....
Bas-Ton and I go way back....
It's not exactly secret, but it'll have to wait. Maybe dinner tomorrow?
I'll tell you another time.
I'm sure Bas-Ton could tell the story better.
Ask your father.
Our story is not important.
When this planet is part of the Empire, you'll share in our glory.
The Voss will serve us well.
The Three have made no decision. Allies must be equals.
We have spoken enough. Our guest grows tired.
It has been our privilege.
Your company is... welcome.
Appreciate you putting up with that. Let's get to work.
I'll pass on dinner. Tell me when you're ready to work.
I don't have time for this.
You won't?
Her ways are not Voss.
I don't understand.
He is a friend. He is an outsider.
I can't get out of this. Stop by in an hour, they'll be gone.
Sorry about that. Now, the tomb...
Go in peace, my friend.
Outsider...? Enter, please!
Yana-Ton, remove incense for comfort. Pour the simple teas.
We're honored.
Don't burden the woman, Phi-Ton.
She looked unburdened.
I am Bas-Ton, this is my teahouse. Forgive my son; may we start anew as the spring.
There's nothing to forgive. I thought the welcome was very kind.
[Flirt] Your son is cute.
Yes. Thank you.
Come in, outsider. You seek the Alien Enclave? The way isn't always clear.
Yana-Ton! Tea for the guest.
Which tea?
All of them, until he finds one that suits him.
I am Bas-Ton, this is my teahouse. Forgive my daughter; we should start anew as the spring.
You're very kind. Is there somewhere we can talk?
Thank you, Bas-Ton.
A woman like that has nothing to apologize for.
[Flirt] Your daughter is cute.
Only the Mystics have nothing to apologize for. I know what you suggest.
The Empire has some questions for you.
Guess you're my contact.
I'm aware of that.
Host the others. This woman is a friend of a good friend. I will share her time.
When tea is ready, host the others. This man is friend of a good friend. I will share his time.
I'm gonna find a man's drink. Shout if they try to talk you to death.
We'd like to see the city, if you don't mind. Maybe look up some friends in the Diplomatic Service.
I'll leave you two alone. I've never seen this planet before.
I spotted three friends from my espionage days near the embassy. I'm going to trade some favors.
Your perspiration increases. You recognize an unknown and respond with instinctive fear.
Don't worry--the family won't bother us, and no one else suspects. Living with these creatures for five years earns some credibility.
That's either quite a disguise, or you're Voss yourself.
You're an Imperial?
They're eccentric, maybe, but no different from anyone else.
The Voss don't seem so bad.
You would say that. But even your people appreciate culture.
Five years of smiles, bowed heads and prophecies.
Our employers surgically altered me to look like the real Bas-Ton. The only way to infiltrate a closed society.
I got to know my family, raise children, kiss my wife....
Five years running a teahouse is a cushy job for an operative--even with the dress code.
I'm not impressed.
Not a dress code. Surgical alterations so I could replace the real Bas-Ton. Raise his children, kiss his wife....
I don't care how exotic they look, their breath always smells like mynock dung--it's some spice in the blasted food.
My... handler was cagey about the mission details. Why am I here?
Let's talk business.
I'm operating on... limited information. Why am I here?
Let's talk business.
Aside from their breath, is there anything else you've noted?
What's their culture like?
I know their tics and their customs--more about their tea than I thought possible.
Problem is, they're stagnant. A teahouse owner is a teahouse owner for life; the real politics are above my station.
I can see why you haven't drawn attention. So what's the word?
It's the perfect cover.
So if I want to get involved in the real politics...?
Who does have the power?
They say the Three run the government, and it's true. But a word from the Mystics can change everything.
So what can a teahouse owner tell me about my mission?
That had better be enough.
Maybe Bas-Ton needs to retire.
If you can't handle it, leave.
Don't get me wrong; I'm here to serve the Empire.
My orders were to find you a lead on Albathius, a human who showed up a few years ago. Voss called him the "Shining Man."
Where he came from is a mystery, but it only took him five weeks to go from outsider to practically Voss.
Went through a dozen rites to earn their respect, knew their culture inside and out, knew their politics... textbook infiltration, impossibly perfect.
You're talking past tense. What happened to him?
Keep going.
Craft is one thing, but you make it sound like he worked miracles.
What makes that so impressive?
Other people tried what he did, went through Voss initiations. At best, they got a pat on the head--like a pet learning a trick.
The Shining Man was something different. The Voss believed in him, and he played them perfect. Then he died, peacefully. Buried with honors.
Let me guess--no background, no known associates, makes records disappear?
I've met his type before.
We couldn't find a vid of him arriving on the planet, and you saw what security's like. Anyway...
Just when it seems the Voss can't love him any more, he dies in his sleep. Buried with honors, mourned like one of them.
No one's touched the case much since, so if you want to learn what the Shining Man was up to, you've got a nasty job. Start with the tomb.
You expect to find something with the body?
Why start there?
Something the Voss buried, something in the body itself... it's a place to start, anyway.
What does "died peacefully" mean?
Tell me about his death.
It means he went to his home in Voss-Ka one night and didn't wake up. Heart condition, they said.
I came here to unearth a conspiracy, not a corpse.
If he's dead, this is a waste.
All I know is our bosses think this is important. Whoever ran the Shining Man is a group to watch out for.
Tomb's at the base of the mountain, holiest place a non-Voss can be interred. Predators keep the area clear these days.
If you want to go in as a pilgrim, I've left clothes and instructions at a dead drop. Give me a call once you're in.
Therod-Ton returns at sunset.
Therod-Ton returns at sunset.
Our family must prepare a welcome. We will speak again.
I have nothing to offer.
